paper_metadata.title: Clinical and genetic profiles of patients with hereditary and wild-type transthyretin amyloidosis: the Transthyretin Cardiac Amyloidosis Registry in the state of São Paulo, Brazil (REACT-SP)
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data and individual patient records.

patients.demographics: Predominantly male (62.8%), median age 65 years, majority white (74.5%)

individual_records.evidence_sentence: More than half of the patients presented cardiac involvement, and the difference between the ATTRv and ATTRwt groups was significant (43.9 vs. 89.9%; p < 0.001).
A group of patients remained asymptomatic (10.4%), with a lower proportion of asymptomatic ATTRwt patients.

functional_data.summary: The study highlights the considerable phenotypic heterogeneity of neurological and cardiac manifestations in patients with variant and wild-type ATTR.

variants.segregation_data: Not explicitly mentioned in the paper.
variants.additional_notes: The study provides a comprehensive overview of the clinical and genetic spectrum of patients with ATTR.
key_quotes: Eleven different mutations were detected, the most common being Val50Met (47.5%) and Val142Ile (39.2%).
The prevalence of the neurological phenotype also differed between ATTRv and ATTRwt (56.8 vs. 31.7%; p < 0.001).

tables_processed.table_caption: Detected mutations in the transthyretin gene

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding TTR variants and penetrance were successfully extracted.
